intro: Ageratina multiserrata, commonly known as the serrated blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has finely serrated leaves. Its small, blue to purple flowers bloom in clusters, making it a distinctive ornamental plant. Ageratina multiserrata is often used in gardens for its aesthetic value and can also serve as a habitat for various insects.
